The Constitution is crystal clear when it comes to our federal elections: Congress alone has the power to decide when elections are held, not the President. Voting by mail is the safest way to vote during a pandemic & there isn‚Äôt a shred of evidence that it leads to voter fraud.

My Health Subcommittee examined proposals today to end surprise medical billing by protecting patients from payment disagreements between providers and insurers. An unplanned visit to the E.R. should never leave insured patients with thousands of dollars in debt.

Surprise medical bills occur when patients are caught between insurers and health care providers, and too often it leaves them with exorbitant debts that can wreak havoc on family finances when they learn they were treated by an out-of-network physician.
